required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Cyclosporine Ophthalmic Emulsion in Patients With Primary Pterygium

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of Cyclosporine Ophthalmic Emulsion 0.05% (RESTASIS®) in patients with primary pterygium (abnormal growth on surface of eye).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Pterygium Hyperemia Responders at Week 16
primary_outcome.description: Number of pterygium hyperemia responders at Week 16 as measured by the Pterygium Hyperemia Grading Scale. The Pterygium Hyperemia Grading Scale is a 6-point scale (0=absent, 1=trace, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=moderately severe, 5=severe). A responder is defined as a patient demonstrating at least a 2-grade decrease from baseline in pterygium hyperemia.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Severity Grade of Pterygium Hyperemia at Week 16
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Severity Grade of Pterygium Hyperemia at Week 16. The Pterygium Hyperemia Grading Scale is a 6-point scale (0=absent, 1=trace, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=moderately severe, 5=severe). A negative number change from baseline is an improvement and a positive number change from baseline is a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Ocular Surface Disease Index© (OSDI©) Questionnaire Score at Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Ocular Surface Disease Index© (OSDI©) Questionnaire score at Week 16. The OSDI© is a 12-question survey for patients to document their dry eye disease symptoms. Each question is rated on a 5-point scale (0=none of the time and 4 = all of the time). The scores are totaled over the 12 questions and normalized/converted to a score of 0-100 (0=no disability and 100=complete disability). A negative number change from baseline represents an improvement.

arm_group.description: One drop in the study eye (or eyes) administered four times daily (QID)
One drop in the study eye (or eyes) administered four times daily (QID)

intervention.description: One drop in the study eye (or eyes) administered four times daily (QID)
One drop in the study eye (or eyes) administered four times daily (QID)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a pterygium in at least one eye that has not been previously removed with surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled systemic disease
- Active eye disease
- Current or anticipated use of topical eye medications other than artificial tears.
- Anticipated wearing of contact lenses

group.title: Cyclosporine Ophthalmic Emulsion 0.05%
group.description: One drop in the study eye (or eyes) administered four times daily (QID)

outcome.title: Number of Pterygium Hyperemia Responders at Week 16
outcome.description: Number of pterygium hyperemia responders at Week 16 as measured by the Pterygium Hyperemia Grading Scale. The Pterygium Hyperemia Grading Scale is a 6-point scale (0=absent, 1=trace, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=moderately severe, 5=severe). A responder is defined as a patient demonstrating at least a 2-grade decrease from baseline in pterygium hyperemia.
outcome.population: Modified Intent to Treat: All randomized patients who received study treatment and had a baseline and at least one post-baseline assessment of pterygium hyperemia

reported_events.desc: The Safety Population was used to calculate the number of participants at risk for SAEs and AEs, and is defined as all randomized and treated patients.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
